data.title: The Shawshank Redemption
data.description: Andy Dufresne, a banker wrongly convicted of murder, is sentenced to life in Shawshank prison. Over decades he forms a friendship with Red, endures the brutality of prison life, and retains hope for freedom.
data.author: Frank Darabont

data.title: Inception
data.description: Dom Cobb is a skilled thief who enters people’s dreams to steal secrets. He’s offered a chance to have his crimes forgiven if he can do the near‑impossible: “inception” — planting an idea in someone’s mind. But the deeper into dreams he goes, the more danger from his own subconscious unfolds.
data.author: Christopher Nolan

data.title: The Godfather
data.description: The aging patriarch of an organized crime family in postwar New York transfers control of his empire to his reluctant youngest son, who slowly is drawn into the family's dark, violent world.
data.author: Francis Ford Coppola

data.title: Pulp Fiction
data.description: Several interwoven stories involving hit men, a boxer, a gangster’s wife, and small‑time criminals converge in Los Angeles. Non‑linear narrative, sharp dialogue, violence, dark humor.
data.author: Quentin Tarantino

data.title: Parasite
data.description: Struggling with poverty, the Kim family gradually infiltrates the lives of a wealthy household by posing as unrelated, skilled workers. But their scheme unravels with unexpected consequences.
data.author: Bong Joon Ho

data.title: The Dark Knight
data.description: Batman faces his greatest psychological challenge yet: the Joker, a villain with no motives but chaos, pushing the hero and Gotham to the edge. Moral dilemmas blur in a war on crime where the only way to win may be to become something else.
data.author: Christopher Nolan

data.title: Spirited Away
data.description: A young girl named Chihiro stumbles into a magical, spirit‑filled world after her parents become transformed. To save them and return home, she must adapt, be brave, and work in a peculiar bathhouse run by spirits.
data.author: Hayao Miyazaki

data.title: Get Out
data.description: During a trip to meet his girlfriend’s parents, Chris uncovers disturbing secrets beneath the outwardly polite facade of their estate. What starts with awkward social issues turns into a chilling fight for survival.
data.author: Jordan Peele

data.title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
data.description: In a luxurious European hotel between the wars, a concierge and a lobby boy get involved in a plot over a stolen painting, a family inheritance, and the looming threat of fascism. The story is whimsical, tragic, and meticulously crafted.
data.author: Wes Anderson

data.title: Interstellar
data.description: With Earth dying, a group of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in search of a new home for humanity. Time, love, and existential risk play out on cosmic and personal levels.
data.author: Christopher Nolan

data.title: Amélie
data.description: A whimsical young woman in Paris decides to change the lives of those around her for the better, while grappling with her own isolation and dreams. A romantic journey full of color and imagination.
data.author: Jean‑Pierre Jeunet

data.title: Blade Runner 2049
data.description: A new Blade Runner, LAPD Officer K, uncovers a long‑buried secret that has the potential to plunge what’s left of society into chaos. His quest leads him to Rick Deckard, missing for 30 years.
data.author: Denis Villeneuve

data.title: Moonlight
data.description: The life of a young Black man named Chiron is tracked from childhood to adulthood as he grows up in a rough neighborhood in Miami. Identity, sexuality, and connection become central as he struggles with social pressure and family issues.
data.author: Barry Jenkins

data.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
data.description: The first part of an epic fantasy adventure: Frodo Baggins inherits a ring, learns of its dark power, and sets out with a fellowship to destroy it in the fires of Mount Doom, facing perils from orcs, wraiths, and betrayal.
data.author: Peter Jackson

data.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
data.description: After a painful breakup, Joel undergoes a procedure to erase memories of his ex‑girlfriend, Clementine. As his memories disappear, he rediscovers the love they shared and fights to retain their essence.
data.author: Michel Gondry

data.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
data.description: In a post‑apocalyptic wasteland, Max teams up with Imperator Furiosa to escape from a tyrant, enduring high‑speed chases, scarce resources, and brutal adversaries in a bid for redemption and freedom.
data.author: George Miller

data.title: La La Land
data.description: Aspiring actress Mia and jazz musician Sebastian fall in love while pursuing their dreams in modern‑day Los Angeles—but success offers challenging choices between love and artistic ambition.
data.author: Damien Chazelle

data.title: The Matrix
data.description: A hacker, Neo, discovers that the world he knows is a simulated reality controlled by machines. He’s drawn into a rebellion to free humanity and learns the true extent of his abilities.
data.author: The Wachowskis

data.title: The Silence of the Lambs
data.description: A young FBI trainee, Clarice Starling, seeks the help of the incarcerated Hannibal Lecter, a brilliant psychiatrist and cannibalistic serial killer, to catch another serial killer on the loose. Psychological horror and suspense ensue.
data.author: Jonathan Demme
